title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis praises the team's culture and coach Mike Vrabel, encouraging free agent signings.
New England Patriots reached the Super Bowl with key free agent acquisitions like Stefon Diggs and Carlton Davis.
The upcoming free agency includes standout players like George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips, targeted by the Patriots.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams, signed for four years at $104 million, ranks eighth among Patriots' best free-agent signings.
Williams recorded 5.5 sacks this season, including two in the postseason, helping the Patriots to Super Bowl LX.
His 13.7% pass rush win rate is eighth among defensive tackles playing at least 10 games this season.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before the NBA deadline, focusing on smaller roster additions.
Possible targets for Celtics include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford for strengthening their defense.
Celtics also considering Pacers' Isaiah Jackson and Magic's Goga Bitadze to bolster rebounding and shot-blocking.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The second annual Something in the Way festival is hosted at Roadrunner in Boston on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Bands like Angel Du$t, Tigers Jaw, and GUV performed, with genres ranging from hardcore to indie rock.
Proceeds from Momma's merchandise sales at the festival will support the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a temporary tent at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice quality for the outdoor game.
The practice tent, a state-of-the-art structure, kept temperatures low to protect the ice from Florida's weather.
Despite efforts to safeguard the ice, the projected cold temperatures on game day made the tent unnecessary.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested in Boston on January 31, 2026, calling for an end to cooperation with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
The protest was part of the "ICE Out Everywhere" campaign, occurring in over 300 cities, advocating for immigrant protections.
Event organizers criticized ICE's increased activity in Massachusetts and urged local officials for stronger legislative responses.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over 1,000 people protested against Trump's immigration policy in freezing weather at Boston Common on Jan. 31, 2026.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and local groups following a 'National Shutdown.'
Protesters gathered at the State House steps, with Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band performing during the event.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests Red Sox may trade for an infielder before the 2026 season starts.
Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker are potential targets, with Paredes offering consistent hitting.
Red Sox could use Marcelo Mayer at third base, splitting second base duties between Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, is surprised by the Patriots' Super Bowl LX run despite preseason playoff hopes.
The New England Patriots improved their record to 14-3, led by second-year quarterback Drake Maye's MVP-caliber season.
Drake Maye's postseason performance has dipped, completing 55.8% of passes, but the Patriots advance to face Seahawks.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX featuring the Patriots on NBC.
Collinsworth has broadcast five Super Bowls involving the Patriots, including their matchup with the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
Collinsworth has covered three defining Patriots games this season, highlighting their defensive and offensive capabilities.
